steps.action: Complete the setup procedures first, include new test folder with today's date.
steps.title: Setup

steps.action: Clone the truchas-extensions repository, either or .
steps.title: Clone truchas-extensions repository

steps.expect: modelbuilder to open a directory browser dialog
steps.title: New project

steps.action: In that dialog, navigate to the test directory you created in the setup procedure and create a subdirectory. Select the new subdirectory and click the `OK`.
steps.expect: modelbuilder to display a "Specify New Project" dialog with the "Workspace Directory" and "Name (Subdirectory)" fields set.
steps.title: New project directory

steps.action: Set the "Simulation Template File" to the ACE3P template that is in the truchas-extensions repository at `simulation-workflows/Truchas.sbt`.
steps.title: Simulation template "Truchas.sbt"

steps.expect: modelbuilder to close the dialog, then display the model geometry in the 3D view and update the Attribute Editor to display a "Modules" tab. On some systems, the model is not immediately displayed, but instead it appears when the "Resources" tab is selected. If that occurs, add a comment to the GitLab issue. Verify that there are two items listed in the "Resources" panel, labeled `sbi.default` and `pillbox4`.
steps.title: Apply

steps.action: Above in the tool bars you should see three buttons with eyes, select the one that says "Show only surface entities"
steps.expect: The color of the model to change to darker colors.
steps.title: Surface Entities

steps.action: In the "Analysis" tab select "Truchas" and "Heat Transfer"
steps.expect: Model builder to open a several modules in the "Analysis" tab
steps.title: Analysis

steps.action:
In the "Analysis" tab under the "Numeric" section set the:
  1. Dt_init = 0.01
  2. Dt_Grow = 5.0
  3. Dt_Max = 60
steps.title: Numerics

steps.action:
In the "Materials" tab
  1. Click "New" and name it graphite-2020
  2. Set the density to 1750
  3. Set the enthalpy to "Specific heat"
  4. Set conductivity to 100
  5. Click the "f(x)" tool & expect a dropdown box (Click dropdown and select create if needed)
In the dialog popup
  1. Set the function type to "polynomial"
  2. In the first row add a coefficient of 240.6 and an exponent of 0
  3. Add a new row and enter values 2.50167 and 1
  4. Add a new row and enter values -1.1231e-3 and 2
  5. Add a new row and enter values 1.7e-7 and 3
  6. Press "Okay"
steps.title: Materials

steps.action: At this point save the project with the in the "Project" tab and clicking "Save Project"
steps.title: Checkpoint

steps.action:
In modelbuilder navigate to Modules => Heat Transfer => Boundary Conditions => Boundary
  1. Select flux from the dropdown menu => New => Heat Flux = 0 => side set 1
  2. HTC => New => coef 50 ref temp 300 => side set 2
  3. Radiation => New => emiss 0.75, amb temp 300 => side sets 20,21,22
  4. Flux => New => 0 => side sets 10, 11, 23
  5. Flux => New => 0 => side set 6
steps.title: Modules

steps.action:
In modelbuilder navigate to Modules => Heat Transfer => Boundary Conditions => Boundary
  1. HTC -> New => coef 500, side set 30
  2. Gap radiation => New => emiss 0.75, side set 40
  3. HTC => New => coef 500, side sets 41 42
  4. HTC => New coef 200, side sets 50, 51
  5. HTC => New => coef 0, amb temp 300, side set 24
steps.title: Interface

steps.action: At this point save the project with the in the "Project" tab and clicking "Save Project"
steps.title: Checkpoint

steps.action:
In modelbuilder navigate to Bodies => Body Assignment
  1. New =>
  2. Material => graphite-2020
  3. Initial Temp => f(x), "Create..."
In the dialog popup
  1. Set the function type to "polynomial"
  2. In the first row add a coefficient of 1500 and an exponent of 0, 0, 0
  3. Add a new row and enter values -1000 and 2, 2, 0
  4. Add a new row and enter values 100 and 0, 0, 1
  5. Press "Okay"
Back in the Body assignment tab
  1. Assign to blocks 2-5
Add another new body
  1. Set the Material to |Void
  2. Set the Initial Temp 1500
  3. Assign to block 1
steps.title: Bodies

steps.action: At this point save the project with the in the "Project" tab and clicking "Save Project"
steps.title: Checkpoint

steps.action:
1. Set End time 3600
  2. Initial Output Delta-Time 60
  3. Addition Output Control => Add Row
  4. After Time 600
  5. Use Delta Time 300
steps.title: Outputs
